title: Anyone find it weird that Kha'Zix doesn't do true damage?
body:
{{champion:31}} {{champion:96}} {{champion:161}} {{champion:421}} deal true damage in their kit, but {{champion:121}} doesn't.

Then again, Kha'Zix would get broken if he did true damage to isolated targets with his passive.

replies.body: Thematically it'd be great to have true damage on Kha'Zix. In terms of intended strengths though true damage is something we try to use only where an ability should be consistently strong against a range of targets. Cho's ult's meant to threaten anyone, Kog's passive should be reasonable against whoever he can reach (and he's a partial tank killer marksman too), Vel'Koz is intended to be stronger against tanky dudes than most mages and with Rek'Sai we wanted to give her a bit more power against defense stacking enemies without offering as much extra power against squishies. Kha'Zix however, as an assassin, is intended to be really strong against squishy targets, who he has multiple tools to reach, and weak against those building defenses, armor especially. True damage isn't an appropriate fit as a result, sad though that be from the void=true damage angle.
with that logic why does someone like {{champion:11}} an assassin have true damage in his kit with having a crazy speed buff plus an older version of fiora's pre-rework ult on a basic ability.....?
Master Yi is more meant to be a melee AD carry rather than an assassin. He melts through people, but doesn't just instakill them like most assassins.

Or it could occur once you have evolved 3 times, so that his early game/potential laneing phase wouldn't be affected as much but his late game has a little extra boost.

By adding on to Unseen Threat, you reinforce the 'safety in numbers' thing, and punish those who go lone wolf.

It would also be cool because then you would be getting a sort of 'trifecta' damage, in that Unseen Threat is dealing Magic Damage, and Taste their Fear would be deal Attack and True damage.

I think you could have putten a lot more effort into this instead of just outright removing about any silence you could find (e.g. Kassadin surly shouldn´t have the instant silence, but as a q-mark->w-proccs the silence combo move it would promote a high risk-high reward melee pattern for him opposed to the usual step->q+e->run away save harrass // for Kha he could have a small silence on an evolved passive to help him out in some matchups without making it overbearing).

what about making the isolation damage a flat amount of true damage which scales with level? that way you could give it that bonus while being able to tweak the numbers for balance. it would have a lot more clarity on the math side, and could mitigate some of his recent itemization problems. On the flip side, it could be balanced in such a way that it's still strong for assassination/dueling, but not significant enough to wreck tanks. Since it would be a per level scaling rather than scaling with AD or something, it would be easy to pull that off.
